clinical_study.brief_title: Evidence-Based Tobacco Cessation Strategies in Patients With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing Evidence-Based Tobacco Cessation Strategies in Oncology Clinics

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot clinical trial studies evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies in patients with cancer. Stop-smoking plans suggested by doctors may help patients with cancer quit smoking.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To assess oncology providers' self-reported need for training on evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies and assess their level of interest in future training on evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies.
II. To test the feasibility of the implementation of evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies in community oncology clinics.
III. To test the feasibility of surveying community oncology patients after a clinic visit to assess provider behavior regarding screening and brief intervention for tobacco use.
OUTLINE:
Patients complete a survey over approximately 10-15 minutes related to their provider's cessation advice and assistance with quitting.
After completion of study, patients are followed up at 1 month.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of providers from the Piedmont Oncology Association (POA) reporting a need for training on evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies
primary_outcome.description: Will be estimated and 95% confidence intervals (CI) constructed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage reporting feeling very confident in their ability to counsel smokers
primary_outcome.description: Will be estimated and 95% CI constructed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage reporting they would be willing to participate in training on evidence-based tobacco cessation strategies
primary_outcome.description: Will be estimated and 95% CI constructed.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of oncology patients willing to complete a survey in an oncology clinic
primary_outcome.description: Will be estimated and 95% CI constructed.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who report that their provider asked about tobacco use during their visit
primary_outcome.description: These prevalences will be estimated at pre- and post-intervention, and 95% CIs calculated adjusting for the expected within-clinic correlation of patient outcomes. These outcomes will be analyzed further using a subject-specific modeling approach to account for the correlation that occurs due to patients being clustered within clinics.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of current smokers who report that their provider advised them to quit during their visit and provided tobacco-cessation strategies
primary_outcome.description: These prevalences will be estimated at pre- and post-intervention, and 95% CIs calculated adjusting for the expected within-clinic correlation of patient outcomes. These outcomes will be analyzed further using a subject-specific modeling approach to account for the correlation that occurs due to patients being clustered within clinics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with cancer who saw a provider will be eligible
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having a nurse or lab visit only
